dialogues.text: Johnny, come lie on top of me. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focus, darling'. Is this credible? ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concentrates) Um, oh... this screenwriter was killed doing research in Jamaica a few years ago. (to Kaufman) Screenwriter, you have a car?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I, um, no, I -- Laroche gets ready to kick him again. KAUFMAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rental, a rental. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drive his car there, leave it on the side of the swamp. That works. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.   I like that. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Kaufman) Sorry. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Donald disappears from the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaufman drives. The headlights shine on Laroche's van ahe Orlean, no longer stoned, sits next to him, holding a gun She skims Kaufman's screenplay. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I had a sense of you from your book. (beat) I had a little crush on you, to tell the truth. You're different than I thought. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't care what you two are you doing.   Please don't kill me. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, here's one of my lines. (mockingly reading from screen) "Isn't it ironic? You adapting my book? My three years in Florida meditating on my inability to experience passion resulted in my finding it with you."

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to do something. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's kind of pathetic, dontcha think? They drive in silence.    Orlean reads more of the screen ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's me! Here's me again! (mocking) "I wanted to know what it's like to care about something passionately." Orlean laughs derisively. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can laugh, but I didn't make that line up. That's a quote from your book. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know, Charlie-boy. Chill. I'm laughing at who I used to be. It's sad. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you learned about passion. (jealous) From Weirdo Laroche. Bully for you. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't learn about passion. You can be passion. And it wasn't John who made me passion. It was orchids. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you didn't even like orchids. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied about what happened at the end of the book. On the way out of the swamp...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laroche leads Orlean through the swamp. He spots somethin on a tree, circles it, and stands there, awestruck. Orlea comes around and sees a beautiful ghost orchid hanging fr the tree. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jewel of the Fakahatchee. Orlean looks at it, tries to feel some passion for it, ca

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't get it. I mean, there it is. I can see it's pretty, but -- LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll get it. Laroche pulls a saw from his bag and cuts the branch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a makeshift lab. Laroche is extracting some gooey substance from the nectary. ORLEAN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in John's basement he explained his real plans for the ghost. He'd discovered a chemical inside with psychoactive properties. His plan had always been to clone the flower and make a fortune marketing this drug. It was Laroche's kind of plan, it wasn't a controlled substance because the government didn't know it existed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlean nervously snorts some green powder off the coffee table while Laroche watches. She talks to the camera. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first time I tried it, the split second it took effect, I understood orchids. I loved them with a passion I'd never felt for anything. For anyone. The drug takes effect and Orlean turns away from us, beco fixated on the ghost orchid sitting on the table before h She smells it, caresses it, cries at its beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it curious? An orchid made me passionate about orchids. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're throwing the truth away for a chemical confusion of your synapses -- ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With this powder I am passionate about everything. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ORLEAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm alive in a profound world now. It sizzles with beauty and horror and sex. Now writing is -- words are -- a way to remove yourself from passion. So I'm done with writing. John and I are making a fortune with this extract. It's big in the Miami club scene. We call it "Passion." (giggles) Isn't that cute? Up ahead, Laroche turns off the road at the Fakahatchee s ORLEAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow him, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laroche parks. Kaufman parks behind him. Orlean gestures with her gun for him to get out. As Kaufman comes around car, he sees Donald on the floor of the back seat. Laroch emerges from his van with a flashlight and a rifle slung his shoulder. Orlean prods Kaufman to follow him. Kaufman shakes and whimpers as they all step down into the thigh- water. They slog through silently. Laroche stops. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This spot looks good. (thinking aloud) Now how do we do this? Hit him in the head with a rock first? Keeping in mind we can only hit him once and only with as much force as would be created by him slipping and falling onto the rock. Laroche paces. Orlean finds a place to sit on a hammock. She unwraps a small square of paper and snorts something of it. Kaufman shivers. Orlean's drugs kick in. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Jesus. Holy...   Hey, baby, hey... Orlean trails off.    Laroche talks to the spaced out Orl LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we drown him, then hit him on the head? Uh-uh. A body bleeds different if the heart's stopped. These new forensic guys are very smart. We really have to know our corpses to stand a chance: rigor mortis, lividity, putrefecation, ocular changes. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LAROCHE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you think we hit him on the head and force water into his lungs after he's dead? No, darlin'. They'll know he didn't drown. See, contrary to popular belief, the lungs do not -- do not -- fill with water in a drowning. What happens is, choking causes an irritation of the mucous membranes. This creates a shitload of mucus in the windpipe. Efforts to breathe turn the mucus into a sticky foam which may or may not mix with vomit. It's the presence of this white foam that indicates drowning. There's a lot to be aware of, Susie. Shoeprints, hair, microscopic fibers. Tire tracks. They all tell a tale to today's forensic scientists. (to Kaufman) What do you think? You're a writer. How would you do it? What's a good way to kill somebody? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't write this kind of bullshit. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get all huffy, I was simply -- Suddenly Laroche gets whacked in the back, flies forward the water. Orlean looks up, spaced.    She's confused by second Kaufman standing there with a bag of potting soil. Donald grabs Kaufman and they run back toward the road. Laroche pulls himself from the water. LAROCHE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck! ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (receptively) Yeah, let's, baby. She staggers moonily toward Laroche.      He pushes her a LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. We got to kill that guy. And now I guess that other guy as well. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disappointed) Ohhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaufman and Donald speed along the swamp road. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Christ's sake, why didn't you do something while we were in the car? DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My back had seized.     I couldn't move. Laroche's van pulls close to them and rams them from behi KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! It rams them again, this time sending them down into the swamp. The van stops. Donald tries to back the car onto t road; the wheels just spin. Laroche steps out of the van. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta ditch this thing. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hysterical) It's a rental! It's a rental! DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! Kaufman and Donald climb from the car, make their way dee into the swamp. Laroche follows them in on foot, dragging Orlean, who is admiring all the plant life. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's beautiful! What's that, Johnny? What's that one called? I just so want to fuck that flower, don't you? LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asclepias lanceolata. Red milkweed. Extremely fuckable. But we don't have time. Laroche shoots at the brothers.    Kaufman whines. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Orlean) What's his name? ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, y'know... Charlie or something.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie! Listen, let's talk! This pie is big enough for four people! (to Orlean) Why are there two of him? Orlean shrugs. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Identical twigs? (laughs crazily) Did I say twigs? I meant twins. Kaufman and Donald run through a colony of sawgrass. It slices them like razor blades. Kaufman yells in pain. Blo oozes through their shirts and pants. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cladium jamaicense, guys. Sawgrass. You want to watch out for that. That's some evil shit. Cut you up. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Laroche! LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tryin' to be helpful. Walk with us and I'll be sure you avoid all the pitfalls. I know these swamps forwards and backwards. There's alligators and poisonous snakes, fellas. Wild hogs. Kaufman and Donald are stopped by a large body of water. Nowhere to go. Laroche and Orlean close in. The brothers run along the periphery of the lake. Donald stops. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait.   Do you hear something? Kaufman stops, hears a distant galloping and squealing. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald, that sounds bad. The brothers run in the opposite direction. The galloping gets louder. It's wild pigs. Donald spots an airboat on t shore. They jump onto it, search hysterically in the dark for bow to start it.   The pigs get closer. Laroche and Orlean get closer. Donald finds a button, presses it, the engine starts. They pull away from the shore just as the pigs catch up. One pig leaps on board, squealing. Kaufman kicks at it as Donald attempts to steer the boat. A kick connects and the pig flies into the water.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Laroche stands at the shoreline and fires his rifle. It nicks the boat. Donald looks back and the boat heads for cypress stand. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out, watch out, watch out! Donald gets the boat back on course. Laroche and Orlean h been left far behind. Donald slows the boat. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're okay. Suddenly Laroche's van comes tearing around a corner and speeds along the road at the water's edge. Orlean shoots the boat from the van window. DONALD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on! Donald speeds up. The van keeps up, the shooting continue Bullets whiz. Kaufman puts his head in his hands. A bulle hits the airboat's gas tank. It explodes in a ball of fla illuminating the whole swamp. Kaufman and Donald are thro along with flaming pieces of debris. Donald treads water, looks all around for Kaufman. DONALD (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles?!    Charles?! Where are you? Underwater. A dazed Kaufman tries to get his bearings. Th murky lake bottom is lit a dim orange by the fire on the surface. An alligator appears. Kaufman panics, surfaces. On the surface, Donald spots Kaufman pop out of the water then get jerked back down. Donald dives. Underwater. The alligator violently shakes Kaufman by the leg. Donald surfaces, comes back down with a broken propeller blade. He hacks the alligator's head off, grabs Kaufman, and brings him to the surface. Donald swims to shore with Kaufman in tow.    Another sho fired. It skims the water near Kaufman. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!   Fuck, Donald, we're dead. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay. How's your leg? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. How's your back.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine.     My back is fine. Laroche and Orlean circle the lake in the van, shooting. Mike Owen, in pajamas, leaves his house, jumps in his tru and agitatedly drives toward the noise and flames. Donald makes it to shore. He climbs out and is helping Kaufman, when he gets hit by a bullet and falls. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald! Kaufman sloshes to shore. His right leg is bloody and mangled. He lifts his brother's head onto his lap. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna be okay. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  But don't let them get you, too. (weak smile) You got a fucking awesome third act. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) Donald, this is an awful, bizarre thing to say and an awful time to say it, but I'm sorry I didn't get to know you better. I'm so sorry. I'm so sorry. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really... You've been really nice. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, it's just I thought I knew you already. I thought you were me. And I hated me. Donald touches Kaufman's face. Kaufman looks at his broth Donald's face glows radiantly in the fire light. DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't do that anymore.      Okay? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Donald dies. Kaufman screams heavenward. The van appears out of the bush, barreling for them. Kaufman rolls his brother out of the way, and limps off into a slough. The follows, smashes into a tree, and comes to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Smoke pours from the grill and is lit by the headlights. of the smoke, Laroche and Orlean appear with guns. They follow Kaufman into the swamp. Mike Owen pulls next to the disabled van. He gets out, surveys the mess, sees bloody Donald on the ground. MIKE OWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, that writer guy. Owen grabs his C.B., tries to radio for help. It's broken He lifts Donald into the back of the truck and speeds off Kaufman limps through the dark water.       Laroche and O follow the sound of his sloshing. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water sounds so sparkly. Like lemon plastic jewels plopping onto a silver trampoline! Dontcha think? LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darlin', please. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we fuck now, baby?    Fuck like lemons? Owen tears along the dirt road. Up ahead, Kaufman limps o of the swamp, into the truck's headlights. Owen is confus He checks the back to see if Donald's body is still there skids off the road into the swamp. Kaufman hurriedly limp over to the disabled truck. Owen climbs out. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta help me.    You gotta help me. MIKE OWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're after me. They've got guns. They killed my brother. MIKE OWEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's got guns? What are you -- Before Owen finishes, his truck is flipped over. Donald's body flies into the water. There, staring Kaufman and Owe down, is a giant man-like beast. It's repulsive, covered algae-matted fur. MIKE OWEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The two men turn and run. MIKE OWEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's real!     I can't believe it, I never -- The creature grabs Owen and snaps his neck like a toothpi Kaufman screams as he runs, watches over his shoulder. He runs right into the arms of Orlean. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's the screenwriter! KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a thing back there!    You don't want to be here. Kaufman, Orlean, and Laroche look back. Nothing there. LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, I don't want to be here. I'm tired, let's get this over with. Laroche puts the gun to Kaufman's head. Kaufman tenses. Orlean studies Laroche's gun. Her nose is practically touching the barrel. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your gun, baby.    Can we trade? LAROCHE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stand back, sweetness. Laroche reaches for Orlean's arm to pull her away. Sudden the creature grabs Laroche, pulls him into the swamp. LAROCHE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie!   Susie! Orlean looks around. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd Johnny go? LAROCHE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susie! Orlean, agitated and disoriented, fires repeatedly into t darkness. Something slumps forward in the water. Orlean steps cautiously over, keeping her gun on Kaufman. The creature is dead, so is Laroche.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying softly) Oh, Johnny. She sits next to Laroche and pets his head.   Kaufman wat her. The sun is coming up. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just stare at your picture, and you looked so sweet. I read your words and I thought you were smart and maybe lost and lonely like me. And the way you wrote about Laroche. You said he was handsome even though he had no front teeth -- ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Johnny. Johnny's teeth.     Oh... KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured you could look at me and see something, even with all my flaws you could look at me and find something, you could maybe someday write a description of me that would be nicer than the one I write day in and day out in my head. (hopefully) Would it be? Kaufman takes Orlean's chin in his hand and directs her g to him. She stares at him for a long while, then: ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really so wonderful. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So wonderful. I can see inside your soul. It glows with orange sadness. It's raining inside you. I want to run through your dripply dripples. It's so beautiful. I love you. I do. Kaufman lets go of her face and sits on a rock. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the drugs. Orlean stands and walks toward Kaufman.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's me. It's the real me. Look at you. I just want to hold you and -- Oh, crap, it's wearing off. Crap! She paces, unfolds her little square of paper. ORLEAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out.     I'm fucking cleaned out. Kaufman watches her for a moment. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, bye. ORLEAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let you go, fatty.    I can't let you make this public. Kaufman keeps walking. ORLEAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? You pathetic, fat, bald... You don't even know how to write! You're not even... You're not leaving here! (screaming, crying) I need a fix! Everything's so ugly! Orlean screams in anguish. Kaufman keeps walking. Orlean shakily aims the gun at his back. She shoots. Kaufman falls, gets up, keeps walking. She aims again through her tears. Suddenly she's pounced on by a bloody, soaking wet figure. Kaufman turns. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Donald! Kaufman limps back.    Donald and Orlean roll on the grou DONALD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother is not fat. He's not bald. My brother is a great writer! He was trying to do something important! The gun fires. Orlean slumps over Donald. Kaufman arrives Both Donald and Orlean are dead. Kaufman falls to his kne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun is high. Fires smoulder. A tow-truck extricates o of the crashed vehicles. State police cars, ambulances, ranger trucks abound. Kaufman is wrapped in a blanket.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He is with a cop and pointing to the bodies spread on a b plastic tarp. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Mike Owen. John Laroche. Susan Orlean. I don't know what that is. I think it might be a Swamp Ape. And that's Donald, my twin brother. He saved my life. Kaufman cries a little.    The cop waits sympathetically, POLICE OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two really look alike. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Yeah. Yes, we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kaufman sits in a booth, working longhand on a legal pad. He's a little scraped-up, a little tougher. A copy of Sto by McKee is among his reference material. Alice, the waitress, walks by and glances at the table. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I love McKee! (recognizes Kaufman, gets reserved) Oh, hi. Haven't seen you in a while. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.    Yeah, I've been away. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you studying screenwriting? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm actually finishing one up. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you! Me too. God, it's so hard to get in, huh? Everyone and their brother is writing a screenplay. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Actually I'm writing this one for Sony Pictures. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Wow. Really?   That's so cool. (beat) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow! So what's it about, if you don't mind my asking? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's tough. Let's see... about being yourself, maybe. It's about learning that if you can't love yourself, you can't really love anyone. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's true. God, that's so true.     It's such an important message, y'know? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, my twin brother was murdered recently --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God!    I'm sorry.   That's so horrible. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Like part of me ripped away. Forever. It was a wake up call. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. You poor man. KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, it helped put things in perspective. Life is a miracle. All life, from the flower to the human being. You. Me. And I want to show people that. For my brother. For everyone. There's a pause.       Alice just stares at him, in awe. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, do you mind if I sit for a sec? KAUFMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're working. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) It's a stupid job, y'know.    I'm Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie. ALICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that name. Charlie. I've always really liked that name. Charlie. Alice smiles, sits.      The two of them begin to talk.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: An enormous chunk of rock, dimly lit by faraway stars, fl by. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: WHITE TEXT ON BLACK SCREEN
dialogues.text: "Let me have men about me that are fat; Sleek-headed men and such that sleep o' nights." - William Shakespeare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Loving Memory of Donald Kaufman THE END
